title: L€G!0N
body:
It was around midnight when I got a call from a government number, telling that my brother Jared had been seriously injured in a car accident and since I was the only family in town, I needed to be there for him.

Oddly enough he wasn’t in the main hospital, he was in a smaller one a little further in a rural area. I’ve passed the place on a few occasions, but never really seen the point of it, considering it was smaller and didn’t offer anything further than the main hospital.

As soon as I showed up I was escorted to a room, where the bed the injured patient would normally be in was rolled out, a doctor informed me that they had to take Jared into another room for surgery.

I quickly got nervous for my brother, I didn’t realize it was so serious that he was receiving surgery already. Regardless, at least he’s alive, so I can do nothing but wait and pray.

As I’m sitting there, I suddenly feel a rumble in my pocket. I take my phone out to discover I had received a text from a number that wasn’t registered on my phone.

“I’m on my way.”

I instantly got a chill up my spine, but opened my phone to check. This was probably just a relative of ours that I hadn’t bothered to give a contact, and they were just coming to check on Jared.

Nope. No text history. This person just decided to text me for no reason. Perhaps a wrong number or mistake, I put my phone away.

As soon as my phone gets near my pocket, I receive another message.

“Wait up for me. Don’t leave before I get there, Angelina.”

Just the fact that this mystery person knew my name made me so uncomfortable, I scramble to write a message back.

“Who are you? If you don’t know me please don’t do this today, my brother just got into a car crash.”

Another instant reply. A photo accompanied with the message “just a car crash?”

The picture was of a car which was definitely totaled, and I could see my half conscious brother sitting in the front seat. But the rest of the scene made no sense.

The hood of the car was on fire and the car was surrounded by a small crater, a low purple light shining out from under the front tires.

It looked so real but at the same time it made no sense, I think they would tell me if my brother got struck by a fucking missile.

I stand up and decide to try and talk with the doctor from earlier, but I get stopped dead in my tracks by another message.

“No no no. Don’t leave. We’re coming Angelina, there is no need to be afraid.”

This time I could actually hear a voice speaking as I read the message, a glitchy and distorted voice that plagued the back of my head with static.

I sat down in the back corner of the room and curled up with panic. My phone begins to ring, but it’s no longer from an unknown number, it’s from a contact labeled “L€G!0N”.

Before I even have the chance to refuse, my phone accepts the call.

“You haven’t left have you? No, I can still smell you. You’re here.”

The same distorted voice from earlier. Every word sounds like it was spoken by a different person.

“I just have some things in the way, don’t worry Angelina, you’re safe.”

Suddenly a large crash played through the phone, just when a clatter of something falling came in from the hall outside, accompanied by screaming and yelling.

I reach down and silently turn off my phone and put it on airplane mode, tears running down my face. This wasn’t happening.

There were some more screams, followed by a loud thump as something crashed against the door of the room. Blood leaked out from under the doorframe.

I sat there in silence for a few seconds, until a new set of words emanates out from my phone, despite it being on airplane mode.

“I’m here.”

The door slowly creaks open, and it takes all my will to not scream at the monstrosity that started creeping in. It’s long arms and legs resembled a spider, slowly creeping further into the room. It had long, sharp fingers and a large jaw filled with teeth so deadly I could drop dead just looking at them.

The creature was shrouded in darkness and it’s veins were glowing with a faint purple light. I could see a tag on the creature’s wrist, labeled “Jared Williams”

It’s mouth moves in synchronization with the sounds coming from my phone.

“Did you wait up?”
author: Vulcan1010101
